meanings.sent1: The team worked together to unify their efforts for the project.
meanings.sent2: The artist used different colors to unify the painting into a beautiful masterpiece.
meanings.sent3: The puzzle pieces decided to unify and form a complete picture.
meanings.sent4: Her speech had the power to unify the divided community like a strong bond.
meanings.sent5: The conductor's baton helped unify the orchestra's music into a harmonious symphony.

meanings.definition: To bring together or combine parts into a whole
meanings.sent1: The chef will unify the ingredients to create a delicious dish.
meanings.sent2: The architect's design will unify the old and new buildings seamlessly.
meanings.sent3: The students decided to unify their notes to ace the exam together.
meanings.sent4: The treaty aimed to unify the nations for a common goal.
meanings.sent5: The glue will unify the broken pieces of the vase back into one piece.
